member.name: T:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced
member.summary: Advanced options to configure GnuTLS with. Source : https://www.gnutls.org/manual/gnutls.html#tab_003aprio_002dspecial1

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.CompatibilityMode
member.summary: will enable compatibility mode. It might mean that violations of the protocols are allowed as long as maximum compatibility with problematic clients and servers is achieved. More specifically this string will tolerate packets over the maximum allowed TLS record, and add a padding to TLS Client Hello packet to prevent it being in the 256-512 range which is known to be causing issues with a commonly used firewall (see the %DUMBFW option).

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.DumbFirewall
member.summary: will add a private extension with bogus data that make the client hello exceed 512 bytes. This avoids a black hole behavior in some firewalls. This is the [RFC7685] client hello padding extension, also enabled with %COMPAT.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.NoExtensions
member.summary: will prevent the sending of any TLS extensions in client side. Note that TLS 1.2 requires extensions to be used, as well as safe renegotiation thus this option must be used with care. When this option is set no versions later than TLS1.2 can be negotiated.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.NoStatusRequest
member.summary: will prevent sending of the TLS status_request extension in client side.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.NoTickets
member.summary: will prevent the advertizing of the TLS session ticket extension.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.NoTicketsTls12
member.summary: will prevent the advertizing of the TLS session ticket extension in TLS 1.2. This is implied by the PFS keyword.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.NoSessionHash
member.summary: will prevent the advertizing the TLS extended master secret (session hash) extension.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.ServerPrecedence
member.summary: The ciphersuite will be selected according to server priorities and not the clientâ€™s.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.Ssl3RecordVersion
member.summary: will use SSL3.0 record version in client hello. By default GnuTLS will set the minimum supported version as the client hello record version (do not confuse that version with the proposed handshake version at the client hello).

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.LatestRecordVersion
member.summary: will use the latest TLS version record version in client hello.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.DisableWildcards
member.summary: will disable matching wildcards when comparing hostnames in certificates.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.NoEncryptThenMac
member.summary: will disable the encrypt-then-mac TLS extension (RFC7366). This is implied by the %COMPAT keyword.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.ForceEncryptThenMac
member.summary: negotiate CBC ciphersuites only when both sides of the connection support encrypt-then-mac TLS extension (RFC7366).

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.DisableSafeRenegotiation
member.summary: will completely disable safe renegotiation completely. Do not use unless you know what you are doing.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.UnsafeRenegotiation
member.summary: will allow handshakes and re-handshakes without the safe renegotiation extension. Note that for clients this mode is insecure (you may be under attack), and for servers it will allow insecure clients to connect (which could be fooled by an attacker). Do not use unless you know what you are doing and want maximum compatibility.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.PartialRenegotiation
member.summary: will allow initial handshakes to proceed, but not re-handshakes. This leaves the client vulnerable to attack, and servers will be compatible with non-upgraded clients for initial handshakes. This is currently the default for clients and servers, for compatibility reasons.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.SafeRenegotiation
member.summary: will enforce safe renegotiation. Clients and servers will refuse to talk to an insecure peer. Currently this causes interoperability problems, but is required for full protection.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.FallbackScsv
member.summary: will enable the use of the fallback signaling cipher suite value in the client hello. Note that this should be set only by applications that try to reconnect with a downgraded protocol version. See RFC7507 for details.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.DisableTls13CompatMode
member.summary: will disable TLS 1.3 middlebox compatibility mode (RFC8446, Appendix D.4) for non-compliant middleboxes.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.Verify_AllowBroken
member.summary: will allow signatures with known to be broken algorithms (such as MD5 or SHA1) in certificate chains.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.Verify_AllowSignRsaMd5
member.summary: will allow RSA-MD5 signatures in certificate chains.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.Verify_AllowSignWithSha1
member.summary: will allow signatures with SHA1 hash algorithm in certificate chains.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.Verify_DisableCrlChecks
member.summary: will disable CRL or OCSP checks in the verification of the certificate chain.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuAdvanced.Verify_AllowX509V1CaCrt
member.summary: will allow V1 CAs in chains.

member.name: T:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuCommand
member.summary: A configuration option for the GnuTLS security suite. Source : https://www.gnutls.org/manual/gnutls.html#tab_003aprio_002dkeywords

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuOperator.Include
member.summary: Includes the given `Command` into the active configuration.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuOperator.Exclude
member.summary: Excludes the given `Command` from the active configuration.

member.name: T:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuProfile
member.summary: Security profile to use for GnuTLS protocol handler. Source : https://www.gnutls.org/manual/gnutls.html#tab_003akey_002dsizes

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuProfile.None
member.summary: No profile specified, so configuration is based on the `SecuritySuite` setting.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuProfile.Low
member.summary: Very short term protection against agencies (corresponds to ENISA legacy level)

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuProfile.Legacy
member.summary: Legacy standard level

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuProfile.Medium
member.summary: Medium-term protection

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuProfile.High
member.summary: Long term protection (corresponds to ENISA future level)

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuProfile.Ultra
member.summary: Even longer term protection

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuProfile.Future
member.summary: Foreseeable future

member.name: T:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuSuite
member.summary: Security suite to use for GnuTLS protocol handler. Source : https://www.gnutls.org/manual/gnutls.html#tab_003aprio_002dkeywords

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuSuite.Performance
member.summary: Enable all secure ciphersuites, limited to 128 bit ciphers and sorted by terms of speed performance. The message authenticity security level is of 64 bits or more, and the certificate verification profile is set to GNUTLS_PROFILE_LOW (80-bits).

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuSuite.Normal
member.summary: Enable all secure ciphersuites. The ciphers are sorted by security margin, although the 256-bit ciphers are included as a fallback only. The message authenticity security level is of 64 bits or more, and the certificate verification profile is set to GNUTLS_PROFILE_LOW (80-bits). This priority string implicitly enables ECDHE and DHE. The ECDHE ciphersuites are placed first in the priority order, but due to compatibility issues with the DHE ciphersuites they are placed last in the priority order, after the plain RSA ciphersuites.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuSuite.Legacy
member.summary: This sets the NORMAL settings that were used for GnuTLS 3.2.x or earlier. There is no verification profile set, and the allowed DH primes are considered weak today (but are often used by misconfigured servers).

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuSuite.PerfectForwardSecrecy
member.summary: Enable all secure ciphersuites that support perfect forward secrecy (ECDHE and DHE). The ciphers are sorted by security margin, although the 256-bit ciphers are included as a fallback only. The message authenticity security level is of 80 bits or more, and the certificate verification profile is set to GNUTLS_PROFILE_LOW (80-bits). This option is available since 3.2.4 or later.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuSuite.Secure128
member.summary: Enable all known to be secure ciphersuites that offer a security level 128-bit or more. The message authenticity security level is of 80 bits or more, and the certificate verification profile is set to GNUTLS_PROFILE_LOW (80-bits).

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuSuite.Secure192
member.summary: Enable all secure ciphersuites that offer a security level 192-bit or more. The message authenticity security level is of 128 bits or more, and the certificate verification profile is set to GNUTLS_PROFILE_HIGH (128-bits).

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuSuite.Secure256
member.summary: Currently alias for SECURE192. This option, will enable ciphers which use a 256-bit key but, due to limitations of the TLS protocol, the overall security level will be 192-bits (the security level depends on more factors than cipher key size).

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuSuite.NsaSuiteB128
member.summary: Enable all the NSA Suite B cryptography (RFC5430) ciphersuites with an 128 bit security level, as well as the enabling of the corresponding verification profile.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuSuite.NsaSuiteB192
member.summary: Enable all the NSA Suite B cryptography (RFC5430) ciphersuites with an 192 bit security level, as well as the enabling of the corresponding verification profile.

member.name: F:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.Enums.GnuSuite.None
member.summary: Nothing is enabled. You will have to manually add `SecurityOptions` and specify the security features that you want enabled.

member.name: P:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.GnuConfig.SecuritySuite
member.summary: Which security suite to use as a starting point. The suite enables a fully pre-configured configuration, which is then manually modified using `SecurityOptions`.

member.name: P:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.GnuConfig.SecurityOptions
member.summary: Additional options to add to the basic security suite specified by `SecuritySuite`.

member.name: P:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.GnuConfig.SecurityProfile
member.summary: Which security profile to use (advanced option that is not normally needed). If you set this, you don't need to set individual `SecurityOptions`.

member.name: P:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.GnuConfig.AdvancedOptions
member.summary: Additional options to configure GnuTLS protocol handling. (advanced flags that are not normally needed).

member.name: P:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.GnuConfig.SetALPNControlConnection
member.summary: Options to configure GnuTLS ALPN protocol(s) setting. To disable the setting of the ALPN protocol(s) string, use string.Empty.

member.name: P:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.GnuConfig.HandshakeTimeout
member.summary: How long to wait for a handshake before giving up, in milliseconds. Set to zero to disable.

member.name: P:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.GnuConfig.CommTimeout
member.summary: How long to wait for a RECV, SEND, HANDSHAKE or BYE API call before giving up, in milliseconds. Minimum allowed value is 15000.

member.name: P:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.GnuConfig.PollTimeout
member.summary: How long to wait for a connectivity socket poll, in milliseconds. Set to zero to disable.

member.name: P:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.GnuConfig.LogLevel
member.summary: Select the maximum verbosity of the GnuTLS messages which are logged with serverity "verbose". The allowed values are 0-99, where 0 suppresses GnuTls related messages entirely, and 99 includes every possible message. Consult the online docs for more help.

member.name: P:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.GnuConfig.LogMessages
member.summary: What additional debug information to log? You can combine multiple of these. These messages all carry a log level of "1", so to see them you must set LogLevel (see above) to at least "1" or more.

member.name: P:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.GnuConfig.LogLength
member.summary: In case of a catastrophic failure, how many messages at maximum verbosity should be output prior to termination.

member.name: T:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.GnuOption
member.summary: Either includes or excludes this `Command` from the protocol security suite, depending on the `Operator` given.

member.name: T:FluentFTP.GnuTLS.GnuTlsInternalStream
member.summary: Adds support for GnuTLS TLS1.2 and TLS1.3 (with session resume capability) for FluentFTP by using a .NET c# wrapper for GnuTLS.
